Sentencas: The performance of a planar SOFC stack using anode-supported cells (ASC) specifically developed for low temperature operation is discussed.
Titulo: Performance analysis of a planar solid oxide fuel cell stack between 750 °C and 500 °C

Sentencas: The performance in single cell tests is compared to the stack performance, and important issues leading to a loss of performance in the stack are discussed.
Titulo: Performance analysis of a planar solid oxide fuel cell stack between 750 °C and 500 °C

Sentencas: Based on the analysis of the contribution of the cell components to the decreasing performance below 600 degrees C, it is demonstrated that the thin electrolyte contributes only a small fraction of the ohmic resistance in stack operation, and that further improvement of the electrolyte may yield insignificant improvements in stack performance.
Titulo: Performance analysis of a planar solid oxide fuel cell stack between 750 °C and 500 °C

Sentencas: The anode has the largest contribution to cell impedance in both cell and stack tests.
Titulo: Performance analysis of a planar solid oxide fuel cell stack between 750 °C and 500 °C

Sentencas: The implications of a cell optimized for low-temperature operation on the stack sealing and anode reduction procedures are briefly discussed, exemplified by the performance loss of the cathode during stack sealing.
Titulo: Performance analysis of a planar solid oxide fuel cell stack between 750 °C and 500 °C

Sentencas: In addition, an unusual breakaway-type oxidation is found on a thin Crofer 22 APU foil in the cathode air compartment, which is likely related to the low operation temperature of the stack.
Titulo: Performance analysis of a planar solid oxide fuel cell stack between 750 °C and 500 °C

Sentencas: These findings highlight the most pressing issues of cell and stack development for low temperature applications, and provide a guide toward stack operation at 500 degrees C.
Titulo: Performance analysis of a planar solid oxide fuel cell stack between 750 °C and 500 °C
